roleset.name: not succeed

example.name: fail-v: sentential task
example.text: Saudi Arabia allegedly failed to honor US patents, copyrights, and other intellectual-property rights.
example.arg: to honor US patents, copyrights, and other intellectual-property rights.

example.name: ARG1 and ARG2
example.text: When Chinese Communist premier Zhu Rongji made belligerent remarks a few days before the election in an effort to scare voters away from the DPP ticket , the ruling party made a grievous mistake , opined Jin , when it failed to come out strongly critical of Zhu and attempted instead to capitalize on the incident by playing the " fear card . "
example.arg: to come out strongly critical of Zhu

example.name: fail-v
example.text: My car failed on me this morning.

example.name: failing-n
example.text: Filner admitted his ?failing to fully respect the women who work for me and with me?
example.arg: to fully respect the women who work for me and with me?

example.name: failing-n
example.text: In other words , both prohibiting enforcement of " temporary workers " and allowing enforcement of " temporary workers " have the same outcome : " temporary workers " are responsible for the failing of the leaders and they are scapegoats .

roleset.note: FAIL-V NOTES: Frames file for 'fail' based on survey of initial sentences of big corpus; nominal 'failing' based on BOLT-7. Member of VNcls succeed-74-2, neglect-75-1-1. (from fail.01-v)
FAILING-N NOTES: Automatically created by Julia as an alias file for unification. (from failing.01-n)
I'm pretty sure arg0 doesn't exist here, and that it's a relic of a time when fail.01 and fail.02 were combined. (from fail.01-v)

roleset.name: give failing grade

example.name: fail-v: I wish I could do this
example.text: The evil professor failed all of his students.

roleset.note: FAILING-N NOTES: Automatically created by Julia as an alias file for unification. (from failing.02-n)
